text: Boomstick: Have you heard of hims?
They're all about makin' you look and feel good.
Wiz: Thanks to science baldness can be optional.
Because hims is here to help.
forhims.com is your one stop solution for hair loss, skin care and sexual wellness for men.
Boomstick: Get started with the complete hair kit for 5 bucks right now while supplies last.
And subject to doctor's approval.
See their website for full details and safety information.
This could cost hundreds if you went to another doctor or pharmacy.
Wiz: So go to forhims.com/deathbattle
That's "f", "o", "r", "h", "i", "m", "s" dot com slash death battle
Boomstick: forhims.com/deathbattle
(Cues: Wiz & Boomstick - Brandon Yates)
Wiz: The elements make an every aspect of the world we live in.
And no average person can tame them.
Boomstick: But somehow these kids can master them with a vengeance.
Wiz: Like Aang, the Avatar.
Boomstick: And Edward Elric, the Fullmetal Alchemist.
He's Wiz and I'm Boomstick.
Wiz: And it's our job to analyze their weapons, armor and skills to find out who will win...
A DEATH BATTLE!
Water.
Earth.
Fire.
Air.
Boomstick: Heart.
Planeteers: Go Planet!
Wiz: Once the four nations lived in harmony and some of their citizens can even learn to bend their nation's element.
But only the Avatar can master all four.
And it's their duty to protect the balance between these nations.
Boomstick: And since there's always gotta be an Avatar around.
A new one is born whenever the last one dies.
Wiz: But everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked.
Attempting to conquer the other three nations; the Avatar would inevitably be their greatest obstacle.
Boomstick: Man they did even go after a kid?
Wiz: Living among the Air Nomads Aang was an energetic and dutiful 12 years old when he learned of his destiny.
He was the newest incarnation of the Avatar.
Boomstick: But he totally wussed out.
Ran away from home and get a frozen in an iceberg for a 100 years.
What the hell?
That's not what I do if I found out I was an awesome elemental badass.
I definitely find a way to make money off that.
Wiz: Boomstick.
He's 12.
Aang: Penguin!
Wiz: But running away actually saved his life.
As the Fire Nation knew the next Avatar would be an Air Nomad.
And slaughter them all in a horrific surprise attack.
Boomstick: But the poor kid wouldn't be stuck in ice forever.
He was eventually rescued by some new friends and began his quest to learn the other elements and save the world.
And as an Air Nomad he can really "bend" the wind to his will.
Wiz: (sighs)
He can use airbending to create whirlwinds and tornadoes or slice through solid stone.
Boomstick: And he can fly.
Wheee!
Wiz: Well it's not exactly flying Boomstick.
What he actually does is manipulate the air currents to keep him aloft.
That's why he carries a glider complete with snacks.
Aang: Oh well I'm sure that'll come in handy.
Boomstick: Whatever.
If it looks like a duck and sounds like a duck it's a duck.
Or I guess, flying Avatar guy.
Wiz: But ducks actually can fly.
Anyway, Aang can use air in every aspect of his life.
Like for shields, increasing his speed, improving agility, adjusting his body temperature and even focusing his breath to use as an attack.
Boomstick: After he learned Waterbending from Pakku and Katara.
Aang can make whips, knifes and literal tsunamis.
Hey I can do that too.
Just give me a pool and watch this cannonball fly.
Does that mean I'm a Waterbender?
Wiz: Uh, sure.
Waterbenders can also manipulate steam and ice.
Boomstick: Just like how I the great Waterbender Boomstick the Wet.
Will use my powers to swim through this frozen block.
Wiz: You -- what?
Boomstick: Yep.
Waterbendin' 101.
You can be jealous.
Wiz (sarcastic): Oh wow I'm just burting with envy.
Boomstick: Bendin' powers activate!!!
Success!
Wiz: Like Airbending, Waterbending requires a nearby source of water to use.
Like a pond or a filled bottle.
The same goes for Earthbending which Aang learned from his mentor Toph.
Boomstick: Earthbendin' it's all about throwin' rocks at people and a bunch of other cool stuff.
Like makin' walls and earthquakes and cause the ground to swallow you up.
Which is...
kinda creepy actually.
Wiz: Last but certainly not least Aang learned the art of Firebending from his longtime rival: Prince Zuko.
Unlike the other arts Firebenders can actually create fire to use at will.
Boomstick: Firebendin' it's so godamn powerful it's even got the deadliest bendin' technique of all: Shootin' lightning.
Wiz: Well only the most advanced Firebenders can cast lightning.
Which is usually an instant kill move.
Wiz: While Aang never learned the move itself.
He has learned how to redirect it through his body.
Boomstick: But even after learnin' the four elements.
Aang got to meet one last masterbender.
Wiz: Who taught him the art of manipulating a person's life energy.
The purest form of bending.
Boomstick: It's super dangerous though.
And one mistake could tear up Aang's soul.
Wiz: And with it Aang defeated the Fire Lord and brought peace to the world at large.
Boomstick: Well with that and with his super form: The Avatar State.
Wiz: In the Avatar State Aang's bending abilities grow immensely powerful.
This is because the Avatar State let's Aang draw upon the power and wisdom of all previous Avatar incarnations.
Though it is extremely risky as dying well in the Avatar State ends the cycle and reincarnation permanently.
Boomstick: Why would he care if he's dead anyway?
Whatever the coolest thing about the Avatar State is it makes you glow.
Like this.
Behold!
(laughs)
Wiz: How are you doing that?
Boomstick: I drank a bunch of glowsticks.
Wiz: YOU need to go to the doctor like right now.
Boomstick: (chuckles)
My liver processed way worse than this.
Wiz: Well with or without the Avatar State Aang is plenty powerful.
He has the ability to move gigantic stone columns and even carved cannons around an entire city.
Boomstick: Not only has he survived hits from Earthbendin' kings and massive explosions he threw this gigantic column of rock at the Fire Lord.
Wiz: To get the column's mass we compare Aang's height against it and determine it must weight 9,500 tons.
Boomstick: Aang's super fast too.
With Airbending he can run on water.
Wiz: Which given his size requires a movement speed of well over 67 miles per hour.
Boomstick: He used Airbendin' to block a giant column destroyin' explosive attack from the best named character on the show: Combustion Man.

Wiz: And he's proven he can redirect lightning from the Fire Lord himself taking into account the distance between them and how far Aang's arm had to move to catch the lightning he would have to react at least a 105 times faster than sound.
Boomstick: He is pretty unused to violence though I mean he's a vegetarian pacifist for cryin' out loud.
But while he may seem like just a kid Aang's still saved the world and led it into a peaceful future.
To him bendin' it's elementary.
Aang: If you want to be a bender.
You have to let go of fear.
Wiz: Alchemists of old once tried to turn lead to gold with...
Not great results.
But in the country of Amestris the ancient science of alchemy is actually possible by using the earth's natural energy to reshape the molecular structure of various objects.
Boomstick: And by drawin' a circle thingy.
Wiz: A transmutation circle which most alchemists use except for the youthful prodigy, Edward Elric.
Boomstick: Aw, what a little badass.
Wiz: Careful Boomstick, he's a bit touchy about his size.
Boomstick: Hey if I lost my mom like he did.
I get mad at the little stuff too.
But Ed and his brother Alphonse figured they could bring her back with alchemy.
So they went for it.
But things went south real fast.
Y'know how people say that give an arm a leg or somethin'.
Well Ed literally did.
And poor Al lost his whole body.
Luckily Ed manage to stick his brother's soul into a suit of armor.
But still yikes.
Wiz: This horrible experience has forever marked the two brothers, no one is meant to transmute a human soul, and the boys were lucky just to escape with their lives.
Boomstick: But he got somethin' good out of it, like super-secret knowledge includin' how to do alchemy without a circle thingy.
He just has to clap instead!
So...
Worth it?
Wiz: With his new abilities Ed and Alphonse began their quest to restore their bodies.
Specifically they saw the incredible power of a Philosopher Stone.
Believing it to be their only chance.
Eventually Ed joined the military and thanks to his amazing potential.
He was named by the Führer: the Fullmetal Alchemist.
Boomstick: Wh- Wh- What!?
Adolf Hitler!?
Wiz: Nah, it's just Bradley.
He’s ok.
Until he isn’t.
Boomstick: SPOILERS!
Also, since Ed lost a couple limbs, he got them replaced with Automail.
Kinda like my leg!
Wiz: Automail is made from incredibly durable metal, ranging from his original steel one, to a gas-powered one, to his best version consisting of a mix of aluminum and carbon.
Apart from being durable metal prosthetics, Ed’s Automail limbs function just like normal ones.
He can even reshape his arm as a weapon.
Boomstick: So, he can turn it into swords and saws and stuff.
Increase its durability by hardenin' it’s makeup, or turn it into an umbrella.
Ah, truly a limb of many talents.
Wiz: But at the end of the day, Ed's true talent lies not in sword fighting or umbrella holding, but the art of alchemy.
Boomstick: He can do all sorts of crazy things with all the elements.
He can basically make anythin' he wants like spears and shields.
Wiz: So long as he follows the rule of Equivalent Exchange.
Anything created with alchemy must have a source of equal value and cannot be made fundamentally different.
For example led can be molded into a statue.
But it cannot be turned into water.
Other than that there are 3 principles needed to use alchemy well.
Comprehension.
Boomstick: Which means you gotta understand the thing you're usin' as made of.
Wiz: Destruction.
Boomstick: Breakin' stuff down.
Wiz: And Reconstruction.
Boomstick: Put stuff back together.
Wiz: Ed it's only limited by the materials at hand and his imagination.
At his full potential he can do almost anything.
He can purify water, create ammonium gas, form ammonium nitrate, repair entire houses and transform a gun into a trumpet.
Boomstick: Don't you EVER try and do that with any of my guns.
Anyway Ed's also learned Destruction Alchemy.
Which does exactly what you think it does.
Make a big old kaboom.
Ed's used it to destroy stuff like Automail.
But it can also be used to explode people heads.
Wiz: So using Destruction Alchemy Ed should be able to destroy something like this on a molecular level.
Boomstick: Haaah!
Or you can just do that.
Wiz: Anyway with all of his abilities Ed has done some incredibly impressive things.

Boomstick: Not only has he blocked gunfire from a gatlin' gun after it started firin', he dodged a pistol from nearly point blank range and his Automail arm even took a bite from a lion headed chimera.
It was totally fine.
Wiz: Asumming this chimera has a similar bite force to that of a real lion.
That means Ed's arm stood up to a force of 1,000 pounds per square inch.
Boomstick: He's created a gigantic cannon and then survived that cannon explodin' while he was standin' on it and then he survived being on top of a huge boulder explodin' too.
Wiz: We can measure the boulder's explosion against Ed's size to get an approximate energy output with a radius of 36 feet; this blast must've  been equivalent to over 100 tons of TNT.
Boomstick: How's that for equivalent exchange bitches!
He also survived an explosion that took out most of a ten story building.
Wiz: Even apart from being tough and has shown considerable strength when using alchemy.
Boomstick: Like when he created that gigantic golem to crush his opponent.

Wiz: By measuring the size of the stone golem's thumb comparing it to the size of the average human's thumb using that scale to estimate the size of the golem that give us an estimated weight of over 3,000 metric tons.
Boomstick: All this without any Philosopher Stone.
Because it turns out those things are really...
Really messed up.
Wiz: Right.
Philosopher Stones are extremely powerful and can be used in many different ways.
Kimblee the Crimson Lotus Alchemist for example used one to create a massive explosion equal to 157 kilotons of TNT.
However it turns out that these stones are composed of imprisoned human souls.
So Ed and Al vowed to avoid them on principle.
Although Ed can boost his alchemic power in a similar manner by drawing on his own life force.
Increasing his potential at the cost of shortening his lifespan.
But that's what Ed ultimately had to learn.
What it truly means to let something go.
And so he found another way to revive Al's body.
Sacrificing his own power for the sake of family.
Boomstick: Aw what a nice guy.
But all and all so long as Ed knows what he's tryin' to transmute he's an amazin' force to be reckoned with.
Edward: Now let's go home.
Together.
Wiz: All right the combatants are set.
And we've run the data through all possibilities.
Boomstick: But first thanks to Blue Apron I've become a foodbender.
Wiz: By now, you've probably heard of Blue Apron the leading meal kit delivery service in the US.
Boomstick: Choose your meals each week get the ingredients delivered to your doorstep and whip up a meal usin' the easy to follow directions provided.
Wiz: It's a great way to get fantastic meals without having to worry about all that tedious prep work cooking at home usually requires.
Boomstick: And if you jump in now, you'll get some delicious summer choices like juicy burgers and tomato salsa.
Wiz: Personally this is been a fantastic way to get legitimately good meals into my busy weekly routine.
Boomstick: My favorite part is feelin' like a master chef makin' creative and delicious meals with my own hands.
You guys really need to try it out.
Wiz: It's pretty nice coming home knowing I'll have a delicious meal I can whip up with ease.
To start making delicious brag worthy meals at home without the hassle.
Try Blue Apron.
Boomstick: Check out this week's menu and get 60 dollars off at Blueapron.com/Battle.
That's Blueapron.com/Battle
Wiz: Blue Apron "A Better Way to Cook!"
Aang: (laughs)
Sorry, Momo. You're just too little!
Edward: Little!?
WHO YOU CALLING A PIPSQUEAK, YOU STUPID HAIRLESS KID?!
Aang: Uh, nobody?
Edward: I'll show you!
Aang: You know there's actually a lot of advantages to being short.
Like you'll never hit your head on door frames and uh...
Edward: I'M STILL GROWING!
Aang: Now I got ya.
(screams)
Oh no I'm sorry.
Edward: A classic misdirection.
That's advantage Elric.
Damn it!
How's this for small?
What kind of alchemy is that!?
Aang: Okay no more clappy magic.
Uh-oh.
Cabbage Merchant: No my cabbages!
Aang: I won't lose to you again.
There you are!
Edward: Nice try shortie!
Phew.
Can't believe that worked.
Aang (Avatar State): This ends now!
Edward: At least I'm taller than you.
Aang (Avatar State): You left me no choice.
Announcer: KO
Boomstick: Looks like Ed didn't have a leg to stand on or arm I guess.
Wiz: Ed may have been more quick witted and inventive and he certainly had more combat experience.
But Aang's bending abilities we're far more versatile and readily available than combat alchemy.
Boomstick: Yeah Ed had cool stuff like cannons and gun trumpets but Aang was fast enough to react to lightning which is way faster than dodgin' a measly bullet.
Wiz: Recall how Ed survived an explosion that destroyed most of a ten story building.
By examining the size of the building and thus the volume of the conical explosion.
This blast must've equal about 30 kilotons of TNT.
Boomstick: That's cool.
But Aang did WAY more when he carved a circle around that city in Avatar State.
Wiz: The force of the blast such as huge revin around the city of Yu Dao was a massive undertaking.
By measuring the width, length and depth of the effected area compared to the size of the city.
We've found it would take almost a 160 kilotons of TNT to pull that off.
Boomstick: More than five times greater than Ed's best durability feat.
So Aang's definitely had the stuff to crush Ed's Automail arm and the rest of him.
Wiz: Granted Ed could reach the source of power by sacrificing his life force.
Remember Kimblee's explosion the one would power a Philosopher Stone a blast worth a 157 kilotons of TNT?
That's almost identical than Aang's feat.
And theoretically Ed could've been in capable this level of power.
Theoretically.
However a Philosopher Stone uses many souls while Ed could only draw from his wand.
Not to mention drawing from his own life force meant his power-up had a very short and dangerous duration limit compared to the Avatar State.
Which has no such limit.
But even so Ed's tactics and creativity kept him in the fight.
Yet the Avatar's speed, power and versatility it's too much for him.
Aang maybe a pacifist in canon and with hardly kill anyone but unleashing his full power is a sight to behold.
Boomstick: Just when Ed thought he had the Aang of it, he alche-missed the mark.
Wiz: The winner is Avatar Aang.
Ben: Thanks for watching this episode of DEATH BATTLE!
If you want the battle music for yourself you can get it by clicking the link down below.
Sam: And if you like to see some more battle and death make sure to click the link over there.
Johnny Blaze: Let's ride!
